comments:
Select a project in the Package Explorer.  Press CTRL+ALT+RIGHT_ARROW.  The busy cursor appears 
and Eclipse stops responding.
discovered on M7, reproduced on latest nightly build.
It seems to be trying to expand every treeitem in the view.  I also got an exception which I will attach.

I have no idea how to select the file ".log" with the Mac choose file dialog.  It's too clever and hides files 
like that.  So here it is:

java.exe is still busy after 10 minutes.  Memory use is constant at 212MB.

I think this is the same thing that happens if you hit '*' in Windows on a
project in the Package Explorer, which is the native key binding for an "expand
all" operation.  Eclipse can end up being hosed for a long time while it tries
to recursively expand everything.  On Linux, the key binding is also '*' (but
currently disabled, bug 96892).

I am not sure if it is appropriate for the application to get in the way if the
user decides they want to do an expand all, but the hang is rather unfortunate.

JFace TreeViewer should consume the native expand keybinding, start doing its 
own manual expand all, and benchmark itself and give up after a certain amount 
of time. That's not asking too much is it ;-)?
Are you offering to submit the patch?
